dialogues.text: So can we consider you a regular, sir?
Well, you get to say, The usual, Col. Things like that.
So let's call this the usual.
He's what she should run a mile from.
Who knows the secrets of the human heart.
She wants me to tell you go fuck yourself.
You could always make it up to her.
When a girl runs out like that, she generally wants to be followed.
Just cut his hair, you know.
Now he can look.... Ask him does he like his hair, Col.
She wants to know, sir, do you like your hair.
What do you think his name is?
I've no thoughts on the subject.
Don't want any of those looks, Col. They don't mean much.
No. Tell him to go fuck himself.
Fuck it, is what I say.
C'mon, babe! You know what I like... Easy!
See, they get the wrong idea.
He's going to take his foot off slowly, David. Then you're to go home, like a good boy. You hear me?
Don't throw my clothes out the window!
No, I won't fucking fuck off. Said I'm sorry, didn't I?
Yeah. I heard. You hear, Jimmy?
What do you mean you can't?
Can't eat through a canvas bag.
So, what do I look like?
You're the one about five ten with the killer smile and the baby face.
How did you know it was her?
Please, man, I'm suffocating in here.
Now, if you took the ropes off, I'd be able to feed myself.
Five ten. Brown eyes. But you're no pinup.
You trying to hurt my feelings?
Well, I could say the same about you.
But I won't. We're more polite around these parts.
You're going to have to do it, aren't you?
They're going to let that guy die. And you're going to kill me.
And even if he doesn't die -- you can't just let me loose.
What do you know about my nature?
I'm talking about your people, not you.
What the fuck do you know about my people?
Only that you're all tough undeluded motherfuckers. And that it's not in your nature to let me go.
Shut the fuck up, would you?
And you know the funny thing?
Didn't look like that to me...
Ah, c'mere. I want to show you something.
Don't you think of it, fucker.
She's mine. Anyway, she wouldn't suit you.
So what were you fucking around for, then?
You fuckers set me up. That bitch --

Okay. That nice lady. Meets me in a bar. I'm saying what the fuck am I doing here anyway. She buys me a drink. She holds my hand. I'm looking at her saying I don't like you, bitch. But what the fuck. Maybe I'll get to understand.
What the fuck am I doing here.
What the fuck were you doing here?
It was a job. So I get sent to the only place in the world they call you nigger to your face.
"Go back to your banana tree, nigger." No use telling them I came from Tottenham.
That game where a bunch of paddies whack sticks at each other?

Well, in Antigua cricket's the black man's game. The kids play it from the age of two. My daddy had me throwing googlies from the age of five. Then we moved to Tottenham and it was something different.
Toffs' game there. But not at home.     .
So when you come to shoot me, Paddy, remember, you're getting rid of a shit- hot bowler.
Take it easy, now. Just go slow. Down by that tree.
Well then, you're going to have to take my dick out for me, aren t you?
Now, that was worth waiting for.
Thank you. I had a case of the clap two years ago. Crabs in Ulster. But all in all it's served me well.
I'm sorry. Didn't mean to offend you, Fergus.
Thanks. I know that wasn't easy for you.
So what's that supposed to mean?
Means what it says. The scorpion does what is in his nature. Take off the hood, man.
'Cause you're kind. It's in your nature.
See? I was right about you.
Where would you most like to be now, man?
Come on, man. If this shit was all over.
Having a pint in the Rock.
You lack imagination, Fergus. Think of something more alluring.
Like having a pint in the Metro --
Having two pints in the Rock.
Having a pint in the Metro, and Dil's having a margarita.
We got simple tastes, you and me.
But you fellas never get a break, do you?
Oh, yes. We do a tour of duty and we're finished. But you guys are never finished, are you?
We don't look on it like that.
I've often wondered how you do it.
Depends on what you believe in.
That you guys shouldn't be here.
No. Not bad. Women are trouble, you know that, Fergus?
Dil wasn't trouble. No trouble at all.
Present tense, please. Love her. Whatever she is. I'm thinking of her now, Fergus. Will you think of her too?
Want you to do something, Fergus.
But they will. As sure as night follows day. They have to. I want you to find her out. Tell her I was thinking of her.
Take the whole lot. I won't need it.
I told you not to talk that way --
Go to Millie's Hair Salon in Spitalfields. Take her to the Metro for a margarita. Don't have to tell her who you are. Just tell her Jody was thinking --
I don't know. Just help me. Give me a cigarette.
I don't want to sleep. Tell me something.
Like the one about the frog?
And the scorpion. No. Tell me anything.
I thought as a child. But when I became a man I put away childish things...
Not a lot of use, are you, Fergus?
Me? No, I'm not good for much...
I'm glad you're doing it, do you know that, Fergus?
Cause you're my friend. And I want you to go to the Metro --
Hurling's a fast game, isn't it, Fergus?
So if I ran now, there's no way I'd beat you, is there?
But if I did... you wouldn't shoot a brother in the back --
Used to run the mile, you know -- four times round the cricket pitch -- what was that game called?
Doesn't the water get to your nails?
Tell her I'm very happy with it.
Not you. How quaint. How old-fashioned and quaint. Isn't it, Col?
They all get the wrong idea.
He wants me to perform for him.
You can't leave me then, can you?
You want me to ask you in, right?
But I'm not cheap, you know that? Loud, but never cheap.
Now, if you asked me to meet you tomorrow, it would really drive him insane.
The one you gave me in the Metro.
Now's the time you're meant to do something, isn't it?
Make a pass or something. Isn't that the way it goes?
You got a special friend, Jimmy?
The things a girl has to put up with.
Tough guy, huh? Are you going to be all right on your own?
I'm not on my own, am I?
Sorry. How'd he drive with his neck in a brace?
Must be in love to manage that.
Doesn't know the meaning of the word.
Tried to. Sit down, will you?
As different as it's possible to be.
Did you do that to him?
You want to know how I kissed him?
Can't think. He's dead. In Ireland. He was a soldier. Went there like a fool.
You say that like a gentleman.
But you can t stay, you know that?
Is this an obsession of yours?
So what do you want with me, Jimmy?
Something I heard someone say once.
If I told you, you wouldn't believe me.
The thing is, can you go the distance?
I'm wondering why you keep his things.
Did he ever tell you you were beautiful?
He looks after me. He's a gentleman too.
Tell him to stop messing Dil around --
I have to talk to her, Col --
Never let the sun go down on an argument, Jody used to say.
Got your note. So let's kiss and make up, hon.
You're something else, Dil, you know that?
See, I was always best looking after someone. Must be something in the genes.
And the fact that you didn't know is basically the fault of yours truly. And even when you were throwing up, I could tell you cared.
My, oh my, Jimmy, how gallant.
Made me feel all funny inside.
Ask me to meet you again, Jimmy.
I didn't mean to hit you.
Kind of liked you as a girl.
Make it up to me, then.
Know what I didn't know. And don't call me that.
Can't help it, Jimmy. A girl has her feelings.
Thing is, Dil, you're not a girl.
I should have known, shouldn't I?
That's true.... Your soldier knew, didn't he?
Won't be quite the same though, will it?
Okay. Be a good girl and go inside.
So I got it wrong, then.
What's wrong, Jimmy? Tell me what's wrong --
She's the thing you had to tell me.
I'm sorry, you know that? I'm really sorry.
And you're not going to tell me more?
Do you like me even a little bit?
You do something for me, Dil?
You got the keys to the shop?
A girl has to draw the line somewhere --
Want to change you to a man, Dil...
You'd like me better that way, Jimmy?
You're no good at this, Jimmy.
You want to make me look like him...
No. Want to make you into something new. That nobody recognizes...
You like me better like this.
Why are we going here, Jimmy?
Look on it like a honeymoon.
Dil! Dil! What the fuck are you doing here?
Told you to stay in the hotel!
Thought you was fooling me. Thought you was leaving me.
I had to go to work!
Stayed all day in that room thinking every noise was you. There's something you're not telling me, Jimmy.
I was trying to get out of something.
You got to forget you ever saw me, Dil.
You heard what I said, Dil?
Are you supposed to take that many?
Only in times of extreme stress.
Dil Can I tell you something? I knew your man.
Lifted him from a carnival in Belfast. Held him hostage for three days.
I got the order to shoot him. Before I could do it he ran. Ran into a tank and died.
Don't you want to kill me?
Don't leave me tonight. Might kill me, too.
Wondered why you came on to me like that when you gave me the look.
He asked me to see were you all right.
See, I fix on anyone that's nice to me. Just the littlest bit nice and I'm yours.
Just don't kick Dil and she'll be touched. Be nice to her and she'll be yours forever.
See, I should blow you away, Jimmy. But I can't do that. Yet.
Let me go for fuck's sake, Dil -- or they'll be here
Give me a bit more, baby, a bit more.
What would you do for me?
I'd do anything for you, Dil.
I know you're lying, Jimmy, but it's nice to hear it.
What was that she called you, Jimmy?
I asked you a question, honey -- were you there too --
And she used her tits and that cute little ass to get him, didn't she?
You've got to go now, Dil --
Where am I to go, Jimmy?
Got you the multivitamins and the iron tablets, hon --
Sorry, love. Now, the white ones are magnesium supplement --
I've got to keep you healthy, Jimmy. I'm counting the days. Two thousand three hundred and thirty-four left.
I'm sorry, darling. I keep forgetting the leap year. What am I supposed to call you then, Jimmy?
Fergus. Fergus my love, light of my life - -
Can't help it. You're doing time for me. No greater love, as the man says. Wish you'd tell me why.
As the man said, it's in my nature.
Give him a cup of tea.
Do you want a cup of tea?
Made the front page. They'll move now, the fuckers.
Request permission to take the hood off, Tommy.
The poor whore's suffocating in the heat.
And anyway, he's seen our faces.
He described me down to a T. Knows what Jude looks like.
You're his keeper. If you don't mind him seeing you, I don't mind. But you're the only one he looks at.
It's nothing. He's just got a sense of humor, that's all.
You're on duty. Keep your fucking mouth shut. Go in and get some sleep.
You'll have minimal contact with the prisoner, do you hear me?
Because tomorrow we might have to shoot him, that's why.
I'm a volunteer, am n't I?
Good. I was beginning to have my doubts about you for the last few days.
Shut up, Jude. You best get some sleep tonight, Fergus.
Request permission to guard the prisoner tonight --
Why do you want to do that for?
Would make me feel better about it.
Okay. You're a good man, Fergus.
So it was you all the time.
And who's Dave when he's at home?
Should blow you away, you know that?
I'm getting emotional. And I don't want to get fucking emotional -- you understand, Hennessy?
And what's she like between the sheets?
And you know what'll happen if you fuck up again, don't you?
So what do you think that is, Hennessy?
It's a knocking-shop. Tres discreet, huh? He visits his ladies on Tuesday and Thursday nights and Saturday mornings. His security's in the car beyond.
Doesn't matter who he is. He is what we would call a legitimate target.
Good. So what do you think?
Whoever hits him'll be hit, if those men are any good. And I presume you can't get in.
You're crazy. Don't let him, Peter.
Leave him alone, Peter. He's in love.
That true, Fergus? You in love?
There are certain things I wouldn't do for my country.
Poke him or something. See if he's still alive.
Hasn't moved for twelve hours. Go on. Have a heart.
Fucking do. I had him all over me.
Put that thing back on him, Fergus.
Doesn't matter if he's hot. Just cover the fucker up.
What was it, Fergus? Did you blow the gaff on us or did you just fuck up?
No. That's the last thing I'll do. You never asked what happened.
Maguire and me got out by the skin of our teeth. No thanks to you.... What you think of the hair?
We had a court-martial in your absence. They wanted to put a bullet in your head. I pleaded for clemency. Said we should find out what happened first. So what did happen?
He ran. I couldn't shoot him in the back. I tried to catch him. He made it to the road and got hit by a Saracen.
But you know what the thing is, Fergus?
You vanished quite effectively. Became Mister Nobody. And you've no idea how useful that could be.
We've got some plans here. And we'll need a Mister Nobody to execute them.
Jesus, Fergus, you're a walking cliche. You know we won't leave her out of this. But I'm glad to see you care.
So I suppose a fuck is out of the question. Keep your head down, Fergus. No sudden moves. And not a whisper to her. You'll be hearing from us.
But, then, I don't have a choice.
And then you'll leave her out of it?
Aye. Then we'll leave her be.
And what if I say no?
We'll be on the other side. We'll move when you do.
Fergus, I think you don't trust me.
Stay late at your work tomorrow night and I'll bring you the gear.
I take pride in my work.
Get that thing off me, Fergus --
Jimmy, is it? Do you know me, Jimmy?
Yeah. Just checking. He being nice to you, Dil?
Ever so nice. Aren't you, Jimmy?
That's good. I'm glad. Young love, as they say.
Absolutely. The younger the better. Doesn't come your way much, I suppose.
Don't go looking for it, Dil.
Well, maybe you'll get lucky. Someday.
A bit heavy on the powder, isn't she, Jimmy?
A girl has to have a bit of glamour.
Absolutely. Long as she can keep it. Isn't that right, James...
No, fuck the bear. The name. Jude. And it's June. Jude in June.
You don't know me, do you?
You'd know I wouldn't run off.
Never pissed holding a girl's hand, Jude.
See, if we took the hood off, we'd have to shoot you. As it is, you've got a fifty-fifty chance.
It was fun while it lasted.
I said shut the fuck up --
